intro: Psychotria bilineata subsp. bilineata, commonly known as the two-lined psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves with a distinctive two-colored venation pattern. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and understorey environments.
